resources.string: These are the 6 short steps for proper brushing!!
The following are recommended for your healthy teeth
Apples are high in fiber and water. Eating an apple produces saliva in your mouth, which rinses away bacteria and food particles.
Carrots are crunchy and full of fiber. Eating a handful of raw carrots at the end of the meal increases saliva production in your mouth, which reduces your risk of cavities.
Eating cheese raises the pH in the mouths and lowers the risk of tooth decay. Cheese also contains calcium and protein, nutrients that strengthen tooth enamel.

Leafy greens such as kale and spinach also promote oral health. They are high in calcium, which builds the enamel. They also contain folic acid, a type of B vitamin that has numerous health benefits, including possibly treating gum disease in pregnant women

Good oral hygiene and regular visits to the dentist will help you maintain healthy teeth and gums.
Here are some tips to help you look after your teeth.
Tip 1. Brush at least twice a day
The best time to brush teeth is after meals. Choose a toothbrush with a small head for better access to back teeth. Soft bristles are kinder on your gums.
Fluoride helps to harden tooth enamel and reduces your risk of decay.
Tooth brushing should take between two and three minutes.
Use a slow and gentle sawing motion.
Tip 5. Limit acidic drinks like soft drinks, cordials and fruit juices.
Food acids soften tooth material and dissolve the minerals in tooth enamel,causing holes (cavities or caries). In severe cases, teeth may be ‘eaten’ right down to the gum.
Quiz 1:Dentists recommend that you brush your teeth?
When you start getting a funny taste in your mouth
Its a personal preference and varies among people
Quiz 2: Next to bacterially caused gum disease the next most common cause of gum disease is?
Accidents such as football injuries, car crashes, falls.
Smoking cigarettes and eating chewing tobacco
Quiz 3: How many permanent teeth do adults have (no cheating - do not count) ?
Quiz 4: Which one of the following can be a factor in causing bad breath ?
